subject: RE: [junit] Testing philosophy question
msgSnippet: ... I like it.  Wouldn t we need another test though that checks to make sure a.equals(b) returns true (or false)? Does the symmetry property hold true for
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Frohnhofer, Jim [mailto:jfrohnhofer@...]
> Sent: Thursday, November 20, 2003 12:21 PM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [junit] Testing philosophy question
>
>
> How about
>
> assertEquals(a.equals(b), b.equals(a));


I like it. Wouldn't we need another test though that checks to make
sure a.equals(b) returns true (or false)?

Does the symmetry property hold true for objects that are not equals?
If so, how about this:

String a = "123";
String b = "123";
String c = "abc";

testAequalsB()
{
assertEquals(a, b);
}

testSymmetryWhenTrue()
{
assertEquals(a.equals(b), b.equals(a));
}

testCnotequalsB()
{
assertFalse(c.equals(b));
}

testSymmetryWhenFalse()
{
assertEquals(c.equals(b), b.equals(c));
}

Kris
